The North American Indian (1907-1930) v.08, The Nez Perces. Wallawalla. Umatilla. Cayuse. The Chinookan tribes ([Seattle] : E.S. Curtis ; [Cambridge, Mass. : The University Press], 1911), Facing page 30

written, illustrated, and published by Edward S. Curtis ; edited by Frederick Webb Hodge ; foreword by Theodore Roosevelt ; field research conducted under the patronage of J. Pierpont Morgan. ; Original photogravures produced in Boston by John Andrew & Son from 1899-1910.

The images on this web site are from material in the collections of the Charles Deering McCormick Library of Special Collections of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections
Edward S. Curtis's The North American Indian

Edward Sheriff Curtis published The North American Indian between 1907 and 1930 with the intent to record traditional Native American cultures. The work comprises twenty volumes of narrative text and photogravure images. Each volume is accompanied by a portfolio of large photogravure plates.  Search tip: shortcut to a list of just the text volumes by searching "illustrated books" in the search bar.

Cultural Context:  Content on this site is drawn from a historical source which includes materials that may contain offensive images or language reflecting the nature of Settler Colonialism in America.
